result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J. Gustin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy J. Gustin

records.addlTxt: 10:35 AM Defendant Randy J. Gustin in court.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Schieffer: guilty to charge with court costs ($543) and DNA sample.  Defendant agrees.   Court reads charges and possible penalties. Court goes over Defendant's right to have an attorney. Defendant waives his right to attorney.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleas no contest to charge.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. ADA Schieffer addresses sentencing. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders court costs ($543 including $100 domestic abuse surcharge) due in 9 months and DNA sample within 30 days. 2 days credit  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:52
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH D.M.S.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Take medications as prescribed.

3:26 PM Defendant Randy J. Gustin appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. NG. ADA Walker is requesting a $2,500.00 SIBS w/conditions of NAC w/D.M.S., AS & Take meds, no objection. Court so orders.  Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:31 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
